metadata.title: CVE-2020-26970 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When reading SMTP server status codes, Thunderbird writes an integer valueto a position on the stack that is intended to contain just one byte.Depending on processor architecture and stack layout, this leads to stackcorruption that may be exploitable. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird< 78.5.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
